data.title: San Diego Housing Commission Affordable Partnership Developments
data.meta_description: The San Diego Housing Commission (SDHC) partners with developers to build new affordable rental housing units and rehabilitate existing properties to preserve affordable housing.
data.text:
The San Diego Housing Commission (SDHC) partners with developers to build new affordable rental housing units and rehabilitate existing properties to preserve affordable housing.

These rental housing units generally remain affordable for at least 55 years for households earning a given percentage of the San Diego Area Median Income (AMI), depending on the development.

Find SDHC Partnership Developments

For a searchable map of affordable rental housing in the City of San Diego—including SDHC partnership developments—click below:

Affordable Rental Housing Properties Map

SDHC Partnership Developments Under or Pending Construction

SkyLINE Apartments

11675 George Cooke Express Drive

San Diego, CA 92127

99 affordable rental apartments for low-income individuals and families (30 to 55 percent of AMI)

Expected completion: Winter 2026

Developer: Affirmed Housing (Affirmed)

Harrington Heights

1320 Broadway

San Diego, CA 92101

270 affordable rental apartments for low-income individuals and families (25 to 50 percent of AMI)

Expected completion: Winter 2025

Developer: Chelsea Investment Corporation

The Iris at San Ysidro

1663 Dairy Mart Road

San Ysidro, CA 92173

99 affordable rental apartments for low-income families and individuals, including 15 units that will serve as permanent supportive housing for households experiencing homelessness (25 to 60 percent of AMI)

Expected completion: Summer 2025

Developer: National Community Renaissance of California (National CORE)

Contact: CLICK HERE to be added to the property’s mailing list

Cortez Hill Apartments

915 Beech Street

San Diego 92101

87 affordable rental apartments for households with low income or experiencing chronic homelessness (30 to 40 percent of AMI)

Expected completion: Summer 2025

Developer: Community HousingWorks

Mt. Etna Drive developments

(Messina Senior Apartments/

Modica Family Apartments/

Taormina Family Apartments)

5255 Mt. Etna Drive

San Diego, CA 92117

Messina:

78 affordable rental apartments for seniors age 62 and older with low income (30 to 80 percent of AMI)

Expected completion: Winter 2024

Developer: Chelsea Investment Corporation

Contact: CLICK HERE for more information

Modica:

93 affordable rental apartments for individuals and families with low income or experiencing chronic homelessness (30 to 80 percent of AMI)

Expected completion: Winter 2024

Developer: Chelsea Investment Corporation

Contact: CLICK HERE for more information

Taormina:

136 affordable rental apartments for individuals and families with low income or experiencing chronic homelessness (40 to 60 percent of AMI)

Expected completion: Winter 2026

Developer: Chelsea Investment Corporation

Contact: CLICK HERE for more information

Tranquility at Post 310

465 47th Street

San Diego, CA 92102

42 affordable rental apartments for veterans with low income or experiencing chronic homelessness (30 to 50 percent of AMI)

Developer: Hitzke Development Corporation (HDC) and Housing Innovation Partners (HIP)

Ventana al Sur

4132 Beyer Boulevard

San Diego, 92173

100 affordable rental apartments for seniors age 62 and older with low income or experiencing homelessness (20 to 50 percent of AMI)

Expected completion: Summer 2024

Developer: MAAC

Contact: CLICK HERE for more information

Aurora

8201 Merge Avenue

San Diego, CA 92129

47 affordable rental units serving low-income individuals and families (30 to 60 percent of AMI)

Developer: Trestle Development LLC

Contact: Email: aurora@apertopm.com, call (858) 886-8810 or visit auroraaptliving.com

San Ysidro Permanent Supportive Housing (San Ysidro PSH)

429 & 437 West San Ysidro Boulevard

San Diego, CA 92173

64 units of permanent affordable rental housing with supportive services for families experiencing homelessness (up to 30 percent of San Diego Area Median Income (AMI))

Expected completion: Third quarter of 2022

Developer: Jamboree Housing Corporation

LIVIA at Scripps Ranch

10380 Spring Canyon Road

San Diego 92131

53 affordable rental units (out of 264 total units) serving families with low income (up to 50 percent of AMI)

Expected completion: November 2023

Developer: Essex and Monarch Scripps Mesa

Contact: livia@essex.com

West (formerly Courthouse Commons)

1011 Union Street

San Diego, CA 92101

41 affordable rental units (out of 82 total units) serving low-income individuals and families (up to 50 percent of AMI)

Expected completion: Spring 2024

Developer: Holland Development LLC

Contact: (619) 377-1337

Grant Heights / Winona Apartments

Grant Heights –

2651 J Street

San Diego, CA 92102

Winona –

3845 Winona Avenue

San Diego, CA 92105

41 affordable rental apartments (28 units at Grant Heights and 18 units at Winona) for low-income families (30 to 60 percent of AMI)

Urban League of San Diego County and San Diego Community Housing Corporation

Group

Contact: (619)727-4465

Aquila Apartments (Formerly known as 3Roots)

9900 Camino Santa Fe

San Diego, CA 92121

178 affordable rental apartments for low-income families (30 to 60 percent of AMI)

Expected completion: Spring 2023

Developer: Chelsea Investment Corporation

Contact: (619) 329-4190

Cuatro at City Heights

4050 El Cajon Boulevard

3951, 4050 and 4102-4122 University Avenue
